edu.handong.csee.java.lab09

Class SalesReporter

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.handong.csee.java.lab09.SalesReporter

  • public class SalesReporter
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a SalesReporter class that prints out sales of salesman.

    This class has methods: getData(),calculateAverageSales(),highestSales() and printOutResults() that calculates the given data of sales and print out the results like maximum sales as a report.

    Author:
    Jun Seob Lee

    • Constructor Detail

      • SalesReporter

        public SalesReporter()
        This is a empty constructor of SalesReporter class.

        This constructor basically asks the user to enter the number of salesman to get the size of arraylist team when the instance of the class is created.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the main method.

        This method just calls different methods from the instances created in an order and the actual calculations and results are given from the other methods.

        Parameters:
        args - user input that can be passed through

      • getData

        public void getData()
        This is the getData() method that reads the detailed information of each salesman from the user.

        This method guides the user to enter name and sales of each salesman and adds each of them to the arraylist of salesman instances called team.

      • calculateAverageSales

        public void calculateAverageSales()
        This is the calculateAverageSales() method.

        Like the name says, this method calculates the average of the sales from each of the element of the team arraylist that are instances of the Salesman class.

      • highestSales

        public void highestSales()
        This is the highestSales() method.

        This method calculates the maximum sales from all of the Salesman instances created.

      • printOutResults

        public void printOutResults()
        This is the printOutResults() method.

        This basically puts all the calculated values together in order and shows it like a sales report.
